column2: AJR, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: For me, this particular drug works wonders, It doesn't take long to kick in. My only complaint is that I wish it would last longer.I suspect the different levels of effectiveness depend upon the individual's condition and symptoms. I take this occasionally when my allergies are at their worst combined with a stuffy nose, most often at night.Despite it having stimulant reactions, I don't have trouble falling asleep, but that might be due to my hypothyroidism. I'm below the normal level of metabolic activity, so this just brings me closer to normal levels as a bonus.

column2: sudafed pe, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have used Sinutab Headache and Sudafed PE (headache/sinus) for 40 years.  It was suggested to me for (shortness of breath), it also relieves sinus pressure, allergy-related headache and fatigue.  I get headaches from scents (perfumes, flowers etc) and also certain foods that I eat (apples, oranges, watermelon and many more) I often feel fatigued for no logical reason and if I take one single (one pill, not the suggested 2 pill dose), I feel so much more energetic.  It has been a "miracle drug" for me and I am having a hard time finding it.  I wish someone would tell me what I can take in its place.
